page.title: 06(CONT.) UNITED BENEFICE
page.content: There is an{unusual tablet}on the wall of the north aisle depicting a young girl sitting with a snake round her arm. She died after being bitten by an adder at Glasshampton. Astley is part of {THE UNITED {BENEFICE OF SHRAWLEY AND WITLEY WITH {ASTLEY.}This scheme was proposed on 18th May 1982 and was published in The London Gazette on{27th MAY 1982.}The parishes are in an interregnum at the moment following the untimely death of the Rector,{CANON J.G.BARNISH,}earlier this year(1985). Astley is very much a separate entity, with its own organist and choir and manages on the whole to have two services each Sunday during this period, while the other three churches (Shrawley, Little Witley and Gt.Witley) have services in rotation and share a choir and organist.
